source_sentence: 自此東南行六百餘里，渡殑伽河，南至阿踰陀國(中印度)，寺百餘所，
translation: From here going southeast for more than six hundred li, he crossed the Ganges and went south to the country of Ayodhyā (in Central India) where there were over one hundred monasteries.

source_sentence: 僧徒數千人，大小乘兼學。
translation: There were several thousand monks, who studied the teachings of both Mahayana and Hinayana schools.

source_sentence: 大城中有故伽藍，是伐蘇槃度菩薩(唐言世親，舊曰婆藪槃豆，譯為天親，
translation: In the middle of the great city there is an old monastery where Vasubandhu Bodhisattva (known as Vasubandhu in Chinese, translated as Tianzhi; formerly transcribed as Vasubandhu) lived.

source_sentence: 訛也)於此製大、小乘論及為眾講處。
translation: It's also a mistake.) Here, he compiled the great and lesser-vehicle treatises and taught them to the crowd.

source_sentence: 城西北四五里，臨殑伽河岸大伽藍中，有窣堵波高二百餘尺，無憂王所建，
translation: Four or five li to the northwest of the city, in a great monastery on the bank of the Ganges River there is a stupa more than two hundred feet high built by King Aśoka.

source_sentence: 佛昔三月說法處。
translation: In the past, the Buddha preached the Dharma in three months.

source_sentence: 其傍又有過去四佛經行處。
translation: Beside it are places where the four past buddhas walked up and down.

source_sentence: 城西南五六里有故伽藍，是阿僧伽菩薩說法處。
translation: Five or six li to the southwest of the city there is an old monastery built at the place where Asaṃghâva Bodhisattva preached the Dharma.

source_sentence: 菩薩夜昇覩史多天，於慈氏菩薩所受《瑜伽論》、《莊嚴大乘論》、《中邊分別論》，
translation: At night the Bodhisattva ascended to the Tuṣita Heaven and received the Yogacarabhumi Sastra, the Adorned Mahayana Sastra, and the Madhyântavibhāga Sastra from Maitreya Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 晝則下天為眾說法。
translation: During the day, the gods in the lower heavens teach the Dharma for the crowd.

source_sentence: 阿僧伽亦名無著，即健陀邏國人也。
translation: Asaṃghâva is also called Wuzhi, a native of the country of Gandhāra.

source_sentence: 佛滅度後一千年中出現於世，從彌沙塞部出家，後信大乘。
translation: One thousand years after the parinirvāṇa of the Buddha, he appeared in the world and renounced the householder’s life. He belonged to the Miṣāsaka school but later believed in Mahayana Buddhism.

source_sentence: 弟世親菩薩於說一切有部出家，後信大乘。
translation: My younger brother Vasubandhu Bodhisattva left home in the Sarvāstivāda school and later believed in the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 兄弟皆稟明聖之器，含著述之才，廣造諸論，解釋大乘，為印度宗匠。
translation: The brothers all possessed the sacred vessels of knowledge and contained the talent for expounding treatises. They composed extensive treatises to explain the Mahayana teachings and served as teachers of the Indian school.

source_sentence: 如《攝大乘論》、《顯揚聖教》、《對法》、《唯識》、《俱舍論》等，
translation: It is like the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, the Exposition of the Noble Teaching, the Abhidharma, the Consciousness-only Treatise, the Kuśinagara Treatise, etc.

source_sentence: 皆其筆也。
translation: They're all written by him.

source_sentence: 法師自阿踰陀國禮聖跡，順殑伽河與八十餘人同船東下，欲向阿耶穆佉國。
translation: The Master came from the country of Ayodhyā and worshipped the holy sites. Proceeding eastward on the Ganges with more than eighty oars in a boat, he proceeded toward the country of Ayamukha.

source_sentence: 行可百餘里，其河兩岸皆是阿輸迦林，非常深茂。
translation: Going for more than one hundred li, the two rivers on both banks are all aśoka forests that are extremely deep and luxuriant.

source_sentence: 於林中兩岸各有十餘船賊，鼓棹迎流，一時而出。
translation: On both sides of the forest there were more than ten pirate ships that emerged at once in one and the same time to meet the current.

source_sentence: 船中驚擾，投河者數人，賊遂擁船向岸，令諸人解脫衣服，搜求珍寶。
translation: The captain of the ship was frightened and several people were thrown into the river, but the thief captured the boat and headed for the shore. He ordered the people to get rid of their clothes and search for treasures.

source_sentence: 然彼群賊素事突伽天神，每於秋中覓一人質狀端美，殺取肉血用以祠之，
translation: The thieves, however, always worshipped the deities of the Tukhāra gods. Every autumn they searched for a handsome man in good condition and killed him to sacrifice his flesh and blood.

source_sentence: 以祈嘉福。
translation: He prayed for good fortune.

source_sentence: 見法師儀容偉麗，體骨當之，相顧而喜曰：「我等祭神時欲將過，不能得人，
translation: They looked at each other and said with delight, “We are about to pass the time of our sacrifice but we cannot find a suitable person.

source_sentence: 今此沙門形貌淑美，殺用祠之，豈非吉也！」
translation: Now, isn't it fortunate that this ascetic is so elegant in appearance and good-looking that he kills and sacrifices him?

source_sentence: 法師報：「以奘穢陋之身，得充祠祭，實非敢惜。
translation: The Master said in reply, “Because of my defiled body I am able to perform the sacrificial rite. I really would not venture to cherish it.

source_sentence: 但以遠來，意者欲禮菩提樹像耆闍崛山，并請問經法，此心未遂，檀越殺之，
translation: But as he had come from a distant land, the Master wished to worship the buddha image of the tree of enlightenment at Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and asked him about the teachings of the scriptures. But his wishes were not fulfilled; so the donor killed him.

source_sentence: 恐非吉也。」
translation: I'm afraid it won't be auspicious.

source_sentence: 船上諸人皆共同請，亦有願以身代，賊皆不許。
translation: The people on board the ship all agreed to ask him to do so, but they also wished to be replaced by me. But the thief would not allow them.

source_sentence: 於是賊帥遣人取水，於花林中除地設壇，和泥塗掃，令兩人拔刀牽法師上壇，
translation: The thief commander then sent someone to fetch water and set up an altar in the flowery forest, removing the dirt from the earth and moulding it with mud. Two men were ordered to pull out their swords and lead the Master up to the altar.

source_sentence: 欲即揮刃。
translation: He wanted to then  wield his sword.

source_sentence: 法師顏無有懼，賊皆驚異。
translation: The Master had no fear in his countenance and the thieves were all terrified.

source_sentence: 既知不免，語賊：「願賜少時，莫相逼惱，使我安心歡喜取滅。」
translation: Knowing that they couldn't escape, he said to the thief, May you grant them a little time, don't oppress each other, and make me rejoice and take their extinction.

source_sentence: 法師乃專心覩史多宮念慈氏菩薩，願得生彼恭敬供養，受《瑜伽師地論》，
translation: The Master then concentrated his mind on the Bodhisattva Maitreya in Kauśita’s palace, wishing to be honored and offered support by that bodhisattva Maitreya. He accepted the Yogacarabhumi Sastra (i.e., the Yogâcārabhūmi-śāstra).

source_sentence: 聽聞妙法，成就通慧，還來下生，教化此人令修勝行，捨諸惡業，及廣宣諸法，
translation: Having heard the sublime Teaching and perfected supernormal knowledge, they return to their lower realms of rebirth and edify these people so that they will cultivate superior practices, abandon evil deeds, and extensively expound the Teaching.

source_sentence: 利安一切。
translation: It's for the benefit of all.

source_sentence: 於是禮十方佛，正念而坐，注心慈氏，無復異緣。
translation: He then paid homage to the buddhas of the ten directions, sat with correct mindfulness, and concentrated his mind on Maitreya without any other reason.

source_sentence: 於心想中，若似登蘇迷盧山，越一二三天，見覩史多宮慈氏菩薩處妙寶臺，
translation: In the midst of my thoughts, it seemed as if I had ascended to Mount Sumeru and crossed over to one or two celestial bodies.

source_sentence: 天眾圍繞。
translation: The gods surrounded him.

source_sentence: 此時身心歡喜，亦不知在壇，不憶有賊。
translation: At the time, he was overjoyed in body and mind, didn't know he was at the altar, and didn't remember the thief.

source_sentence: 同伴諸人發聲號哭。
translation: The companions cried out in tears.

source_sentence: 須臾之間黑風四起，折樹飛沙，河流涌浪，船舫漂覆，賊徒大駭，問同伴曰：「沙門從何處來？
translation: In a moment, black winds rose in all directions and shattered the trees and flying sand. The rivers flowed high and the boats and sails floated on the shore. The thieves were greatly frightened and asked their companions, “Where are you coming from?” The śramaṇas said:

source_sentence: 名字何等？」
translation: What's the name?

source_sentence: 報曰：「從支那國來求法者此也。
translation: He replied, “This is the one who came from China to seek the Dharma.

source_sentence: 諸君若殺，得無量罪。
translation: If you kill, you'll be guilty of an immeasurable offense.

source_sentence: 且觀風波之狀，天神已瞋，宜急懺悔。」
translation: Observing the wind and waves, the gods are angry, so it's advisable to repent quickly.

source_sentence: 賊懼，相率懺謝，稽首歸依。
translation: Fearful, the thieves quickly apologized to each other and bowed their heads in respect.

source_sentence: 時亦不覺，賊以手觸，爾乃開目，謂賊曰：「時至耶？」
translation: When the thief touched it with his hand, he opened his eyes and said to the thief, Is it time?

source_sentence: 賊曰：「不敢害師，願受懺悔。」
translation: The thief said, I won't dare harm my teacher; I wish to repent.

source_sentence: 法師受其禮謝，為說殺盜邪祠諸不善業，未來當受無間之苦。
translation: Accepting his thanks, the Master told him about the unwholesome acts of killing, stealing, and evil deeds at wrong shrines, which will cause future suffering without interruption.

source_sentence: 何為電光朝露少時之身，作阿僧企耶長時苦種！
translation: Why is it that a lightning flash in the morning exposes one's body for a short time and creates an incalculable amount of suffering for a long time?

source_sentence: 賊等叩頭謝曰：「某等妄想顛倒，為所不應為，事所不應事。
translation: The thieves bowed their heads and apologized, saying, Such-and-such deluded thoughts are mistaken, doing what shouldn't be done and doing what shouldn't be done.

source_sentence: 若不逢師福德感動冥祇，何以得聞啟誨。
translation: If they hadn't met the teacher's blessedness and virtue, how could they have heard his exhortation?

source_sentence: 請從今日已去即斷此業，願師證明。」
translation: Please stop this practice from today onward, and may your teacher prove it.

source_sentence: 於是遞相勸告，收諸劫具總投河流，所奪衣資各還本主，並受五戒，風波還靜。
translation: They then told each other to gather the treasures and throw them all into the river's stream, returning their robes and possessions to their original owners, and accepting the five precepts, the wind and waves returned to quiescence.

source_sentence: 賊眾歡喜，頂禮辭別。
translation: Rejoicing, the thieves bowed their heads in respect and departed.

source_sentence: 同伴敬歎轉異於常。
translation: The companions revered him and admired him, which was different from usual.

source_sentence: 遠近聞者莫不嗟怪。
translation: Everyone from near and far who heard it marveled at this.

source_sentence: 非求法殷重，何以致茲。
translation: If it were not for the great importance of seeking the Dharma, how could this be so?

source_sentence: 從此東行三百餘里，渡殑伽河，北至阿耶穆佉國(中印度)。
translation: From here going eastward for more than three hundred li, I crossed the Ganges and reached the country of Ayamukha (in Central India) to the north.

source_sentence: 從此東南行七百餘里，渡殑伽河南、閻牟那河北，至鉢羅耶伽國(中印度)。
translation: From here going southeast for more than seven hundred li, the Master crossed the Ganges to the southwest of Jambudvīpa and reached the country of Bālāyaga (in Central India).

source_sentence: 城西南瞻博迦花林中有窣堵波，無憂王所造，是佛昔降外道處。
translation: To the southwest of the city was a stupa built by King Aśoka at the place where the Buddha had formerly subdued heretics.

source_sentence: 其側有伽藍，是提婆菩薩作《廣百論》挫小乘外道處。
translation: Beside it is a monastery built at the place where Deva Bodhisattva composed the Vibhasamparinirmocana Sastra to suppress heretics of the Hinayana school.

source_sentence: 大城東兩河交處，其西有墠，周十四五里，土地平正，自古已來諸王豪族仁慈惠施，
translation: The great city is fourteen or fifteen li in circuit at the crossroads of two rivers to the east, with a moat on the west. The soil is even and well-drained; since ancient times various kings and powerful families have offered kindness and benevolence to the monastery.

source_sentence: 皆至於此，因號其處為大施場。
translation: They all went to this place and called it the Great Place of Almsgiving.

source_sentence: 今戒日王亦繼斯軌，五年積財，七十五日散施，上從三寶，下至孤窮，
translation: King Siladitya now follows this example, accumulating his wealth for five years and giving it away on the seventy-fiveth day. From the highest of the Three Treasures up to the lonely and impoverished, he gives almsfood [to those who need it].

source_sentence: 無不悉施。
translation: There's nothing that isn't fully given.

source_sentence: 從此西南入大林，多逢惡獸、野象。
translation: From here proceeding southwest, one enters a great forest and encounters many dangerous animals and wild elephants.

source_sentence: 經五百餘里，至憍賞彌國(舊曰俱睒彌，訛。
translation: Going for more than five hundred li, he reached the country of Kausambi (formerly transcribed as Jumbi erroneously).

source_sentence: 中印度)。
translation: Central India).

source_sentence: 伽藍十餘所，僧徒三百餘人。
translation: There are over ten monasteries with more than three hundred monks.

source_sentence: 城內故宮中有大精舍，高六十餘尺，有刻檀佛像，上懸石蓋，鄔陀衍那王(唐言出愛，
translation: In the old palace inside the city there was a great temple more than sixty feet high, with an image of the Buddha carved out of sandalwood and a stone canopy suspended above it. This was the place where King Udayana (known as Yutai in Chinese) lived.

source_sentence: 舊云優填王，訛)之所造也。
translation: It was produced by the old saying, King Udayana (which is a mistake).

source_sentence: 昔如來在忉利天經夏為母說法，王思慕，乃請目連將巧工升天觀佛尊顏容止，
translation: Formerly, when the Tathāgata was preaching the Dharma to his mother in Trāyastriṃśa gods for the duration of the summer season, the king longed to see him. So he invited Maudgalyāyana, accompanied by a skillful artisan, to go up to heaven to see the Buddha’s countenance and demeanor.

source_sentence: 還以紫檀雕刻以像真容，世尊下來時，像迎佛，即此也。
translation: When the World-honored One came down, the image greeted the Buddha. This was precisely the place where it had been carved out of purple sandalwood and engraved with its true form.

source_sentence: 城南有故宅，是瞿史羅(舊曰瞿師羅，訛)長者故居也。
translation: To the south of the city there was an old residence of the wealthy householder Ghoṣila (formerly transcribed as Ghoṣila in error).

source_sentence: 城南不遠有故伽藍，即長者之園地。
translation: Not far to the south of the city there is an old monastery built at the place where the wealthy man’s garden was.

source_sentence: 中有窣堵波，高二百餘尺，無憂王所造。
translation: In the middle was a stupa more than two hundred feet high, built by King Aśoka.

source_sentence: 次東南重閣是世親造《唯識論》處。
translation: Next, to the southeast, there's a multistoried pavilion where Vasubandhu created the Consciousness-only Treatise.

source_sentence: 次東菴沒羅林有故基，是無著菩薩作《顯揚論》處。
translation: Next to the east, there's an old foundation in the mango grove, which was the place where Asaṅga Bodhisattva composed the Prakaraṇapāda-śāstra.

source_sentence: 從此東行五百餘里，至鞞索迦國。
translation: From here going eastward for more than five hundred li, I reached the country ofisesaka.

source_sentence: 伽藍二十餘所，僧三千許人，學小乘正量部。
translation: There were more than twenty monasteries with some three thousand monks, all of whom studied the Sammitya sect of the Hinayana school.

source_sentence: 東南道左有大伽藍，是昔提婆設摩阿羅漢造《識身足論》，說無我人，
translation: To the southeast of the road there is a big monastery built at the left side of the road. This was the place where Devasaṃma, an arhat, composed the Consciousness-body Treatise in olden times and preached the doctrine of selflessness.

source_sentence: 瞿波阿羅漢作《聖教要實論》，說有我人，因此法執，遂深諍論。
translation: The arhat Gopal composed the Treatise on the Essentials of the Noble Teaching, saying that there is a self and person. Because of this attachment to the doctrine, he deeply debated it.

source_sentence: 又是護法菩薩七日中摧伏小乘一百論師處。
translation: It's also the place where Dharmapāla Bodhisattva subdued the one hundred treatise masters of the lesser vehicle in seven days.

source_sentence: 其側又有如來六年說法處。
translation: Beside it is another place where the Tathāgata preached the Dharma for six years.

source_sentence: 有一樹高七十餘尺，昔佛因淨齒，棄其餘枝，遂植根繁茂至今。
translation: There was a tree more than seventy feet high. Formerly when the Buddha had his teeth whitened, he discarded the remaining branches and so planted roots that flourished until today.

source_sentence: 邪見之徒數來殘伐，隨伐隨生，榮茂如本。
translation: Many heretics came to cut down the old trees, but as soon as they were cut down and planted new trees grew in abundance just as before.

source_sentence: 從此東北行五百餘里，至室羅伐悉底國(舊曰舍衛，訛也)。
translation: From here going northeast for more than five hundred li, I reached the country of Śrāvastī (formerly transcribed as Shewei erroneously).

source_sentence: 周六千餘里，伽藍數百，僧徒數千，並學正量部。
translation: It is more than six thousand li in circuit and there are several hundred monasteries with several thousand monks, all of whom study the Sammitya school.

source_sentence: 佛在時，鉢羅斯那恃多(唐言勝軍，舊曰波斯匿，訛)王所居都也。
translation: When the Buddha was still alive, it was the capital of the king Prasenajit (known as Vaiśravaṇa in Chinese; formerly transcribed incorrectly as Puṣyani in olden times).

source_sentence: 城內有王殿故基，次東不遠有故基，上建窣堵波，勝軍王為佛造大講堂處。
translation: Within the city there is an old foundation of the royal pavilion, not far to the east of which is an old foundation on which is enshrined a stupa built at the place where King Prasenajit constructed a great assembly hall for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 次復有塔，是佛姨母鉢羅闍鉢底(唐言生主，舊曰波闍波提，訛也)比丘尼精舍。
translation: Next, there's another stūpa, which is the Buddha's aunt Prajñāpati (known as Shengzhu (known as Puṣyapātti in Chinese; formerly transcribed incorrectly as Pojapoti in olden times), a monk and nun monastery.

source_sentence: 次東有塔，是蘇達多(唐言樂施，舊曰須達，訛也)故宅。
translation: Next to the east was a stupa built at the old residence of Sudarśana (known as Lokeśvara in Chinese, formerly transcribed incorrectly as Sudarśana in olden times).

source_sentence: 宅側有大窣堵波，是鴦窶利摩羅(舊曰央崛摩羅，訛也)捨邪之處。
translation: Beside the residence is a great stupa built at the place where Aṅgulimālya (formerly transcribed incorrectly as Yang halbāra) abandoned his evil deeds.

source_sentence: 城南五六里有逝多林(唐曰言勝林，舊曰祇陀，訛也)。
translation: Five or six li to the south of the city was Jeta’s Grove (known as Shenglin in Chinese, formerly transcribed incorrectly as Qituo).

source_sentence: 即給孤獨園也。
translation: That's the Anāthapiṇḍada Park.

source_sentence: 昔為伽藍，今已頹毀。
translation: Formerly it was a monastery but is now in ruins.

source_sentence: 東門左右各建石柱，高七十餘尺，無憂王所立。
translation: At each side of the east gate a stone pillar more than seventy feet in height was built, erected by King Aśoka.

source_sentence: 諸屋並盡，獨一塼室在，中有金像。
translation: All the houses were completely destroyed, leaving behind a single brick chamber in which was enshrined a golden image.

source_sentence: 昔佛昇天為母說法，勝軍王心生戀慕，聞出愛王刻檀為像，因造此也。
translation: Formerly when the Buddha ascended to heaven and preached the Dharma to his mother, King Prasenajit had a feeling of affection for him. Hearing that King Udayana wished to have an image carved out of sandalwood wood, so he produced one.

source_sentence: 伽藍後不遠是外道梵志殺婦謗佛處。
translation: Not far behind the Kālāma, there's a place where non-Buddhist priests killed women and denigrated the Buddha.

source_sentence: 伽藍東百餘步有大深坑，是提婆達多以毒藥害佛生身入地獄處。
translation: More than one hundred paces to the east of the monastery is a great deep pit where Devadatta entered hell alive in order to harm the Buddha with poisonous medicine.

source_sentence: 其南復有大坑，瞿伽梨比丘謗佛生身入地獄處。
translation: To the south of it was another great pit, where a monk named Kokālika denigrated the Buddha and fled into hell alive.

source_sentence: 坑南八百餘步，是戰遮婆羅門女謗佛生身入地獄處。
translation: More than eight hundred paces to the south of the pit was the place where Chanda, a brahman woman who had slandered the Buddha and entered hell alive.

source_sentence: 凡此三坑，窺不見底。
translation: All these three pits are invisible to the bottom.

source_sentence: 伽藍東七十餘步，有精舍高大。
translation: More than seventy paces to the east of the monastery is a large and tall temple.

source_sentence: 中有佛像東面坐，如來昔共外道論議處。
translation: In the middle was an image of the Buddha seated facing east. This was the place where the Tathāgata had formerly held discussions with heretics.

source_sentence: 次東有天祠，量等精舍，日光移轉，天祠影不及精舍，精舍影常覆天祠。
translation: Next to the east is a deva temple of the same size as the monastery. The sunlight moves and the shadow of the deva temple does not match that of the monastery, but the shadow of the monastery always covers the deva temple.

source_sentence: 次東三四里有窣堵波，是舍利子與外道論議處。
translation: Three or four li to the east, there was another stupa built at the place where Śāriputra had a discussion with heretics.

source_sentence: 大城西北六十餘里有故城，是賢劫中人壽二萬歲時，迦葉波佛父城也。
translation: More than sixty li to the northwest of the great city is an old city that was the hometown of Kāśyapa Buddha at the time when the human life span was twenty thousand years in the Bhadrakalpa.

source_sentence: 城南是佛成正覺已初見父處。
translation: To the south of the city is the place where the Buddha first saw his father after he became perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 城北有塔，塔有迦葉波佛全身舍利，並無憂王所立。
translation: To the north of the city there was a stupa in which were preserved the relics of Kāśyapa Buddha’s entire body. They were all erected by King Aśoka.

source_sentence: 從此東南行八百餘里，至劫比羅伐窣堵國(舊曰迦毘羅衛國)。
translation: From here going southeast for more than eight hundred li, I reached the country of Kapilavastu (formerly known as Kapilavastu).

source_sentence: 國周四千餘里，都城十餘里，並皆頹毀，宮城周十五里，壘塼而成，極牢固。
translation: The country is more than four thousand li in circuit and its capital city is over ten li in circuit. All of them have all been decayed; the palace city, fifteen li in circuit, has been built of bricks that are extremely strong.

source_sentence: 內有故基，淨飯王之正殿，上建精舍，中作王像。
translation: Inside the monastery there was an old foundation of the main hall of King Śuddhodana, in which a statue of the king was enshrined.

source_sentence: 次北有故基，是摩耶夫人之寢殿，上建精舍，中作夫人之像。
translation: Next to the north, there is an old foundation that marks the place where Lady Maya’s sleeping quarters are situated. A temple has been built on top of the foundation and a statue of the lady in it is enshrined.

source_sentence: 其側有精舍，是釋迦菩薩降神母胎處，中作菩薩降生之像。
translation: Beside it is a shrine at the place where Śākya Bodhisattva descended from his mother’s womb. In this shrine an image of the Bodhisattva entering into rebirth is preserved.

source_sentence: 上坐部云，菩薩以嗢怛羅頞娑荼月三十日夜降神母胎，當此五月十五日。
translation: The Sthavira school says that the Bodhisattva descended to his mother's womb on the night of the 30th day of the month in Uttarakuru, corresponding to the 15th day of the fifth month here.

source_sentence: 諸部則以此二十三日，當此五月八日。
translation: The various schools then take this twenty-three days as the eighth day of the fifth month.

source_sentence: 東北有窣堵波，阿私陀仙相太子處。
translation: To the northeast, there is a stupa at the place where the prince Asita’s holy figure was enshrined.

source_sentence: 於城左右有太子共諸釋種捔力處。
translation: To the left and right of the city, there's a place where the prince shares the power of the Śākyamuni clan's argument.

source_sentence: 又有太子乘馬踰城處，及先於四門見老、病、死及沙門，厭離世間迴駕處。
translation: Again, the prince rode his horse over the city and saw old age, illness, death, and the ascetics in the four directions who were disillusioned with the world and drove around.

source_sentence: 從此東行荒林五百餘里，至藍摩國(中印度)。
translation: From here going eastward for more than five hundred li through a wild jungle, I reached the country of Rāma (in Central India).

source_sentence: 居人稀少。
translation: The inhabitants are scarce.

source_sentence: 故城東南有塼窣堵波，高五十餘尺，如來涅槃後，此國先王分得舍利，
translation: To the southeast of the old city there is a stupa more than fifty feet in height. After the nirvana of the Tathāgata, a former king of this country obtained a portion of his relic bones.

source_sentence: 還而造也，每放光明。
translation: He returned and built it, and each time he radiated his light.

source_sentence: 其側有龍池，龍數變身為人，繞塔行道，野象銜花常來供養。
translation: Beside it is a dragon pond, in which the dragons often transformed themselves into human beings. They circumambulated the stupas and walked on the paths; wild elephants carried flowers to offer as offerings.

source_sentence: 其側不遠有伽藍，以沙彌知寺任。
translation: Not far from it was a monastery, in which there was a śrāmaṇer who knew all the affairs of the monastery.

source_sentence: 相傳昔有苾芻招命同學，遠來禮拜，見野象銜花，安置塔前，復以牙芟草，
translation: It is said that once in the past a bhikṣu invited some of his fellow monks from distant lands to worship him. They saw wild elephants carrying flowers and placed them in front of the stupa, as well as grass with fangs on its back.

source_sentence: 以鼻灑水，眾見無不感歎。
translation: He sprinkled water with his nose, and all the people who saw him marveled at it.

source_sentence: 有一苾芻便捨大戒，願留供養，謂眾人曰：「象是畜生，猶知敬塔獻花灑掃，
translation: One bhikṣu renounced the Great Precepts and wished to keep them as an offering. He said to the people, “The elephant is an animal that knows how to honor the stupa by offering flowers and sweeping away dirt.

source_sentence: 我居人類，依佛出家，豈可目覩荒殘，不供事也！」
translation: I live among humans and rely on the Buddha to leave home, so why wouldn't I be able to look into the wilderness and not serve him?

source_sentence: 即辭眾住，結宇疏池，種花殖菓，雖涉寒暑，不以勞惓。
translation: So he renounced the householder’s life and built a monastery to live in. He sowed flowers and planted fruit in the pond but did not suffer from exhaustion even during cold and hot seasons.

source_sentence: 隣國聞之，各捨財寶，共建伽藍，仍即屈知僧務，自此相承，遂為故事矣。
translation: When the neighboring countries heard this, they each gave up their wealth and treasures to build a monastery. The monastic affairs of the monastery were then neglected in order to keep track of the matters for the sake of the Sangha. This story was transmitted from one country to another as a tradition.

source_sentence: 沙彌伽藍東大林中行百餘里，有窣堵波，無憂王所建，是太子踰城至此，
translation: More than one hundred li to the east of the śrāmaṇera’s monastery, in a big forest to the east of the stupa, there is a stupa built by King Aśoka at the place where the prince came from the city.

source_sentence: 解寶衣、天冠、髻珠付闡鐸迦(舊曰車匿，訛)還處也。
translation: He untied his precious robe, celestial crown, and the topknot beads and handed them to Chandaka (formerly transcribed as Cheni erroneously) to return home.

source_sentence: 及剃髮，皆有塔記。
translation: Both the stupas and the shaving images are enshrined in them.

source_sentence: 出此林已，至拘尸那揭羅國。
translation: After leaving this forest, he reached the country of Kuśinagara.

source_sentence: 處極荒梗。
translation: The place is extremely desolate and barren.

source_sentence: 城內東北隅有窣堵波，無憂王所建，准陀故宅(舊曰純陀，訛)。
translation: At the northeast corner of the city there is a stupa built by King Aśoka at the old residence of Cunda (formerly transcribed incorrectly as Chunda).

source_sentence: 宅中有井，將營獻供時鑿也，水猶澄映。
translation: In the residence there is a well, which was dug at the time when he was about to make offerings and the water is still clear and bright.

source_sentence: 城西北三四里，渡阿恃多伐底河(唐言無勝，舊曰阿利跋提河，訛)。
translation: Three or four li to the northwest of the city, he crossed the Ajitavartī River (known as Wuxing in Chinese; formerly transcribed incorrectly as alibhatī).

source_sentence: 河側不遠至娑羅林，其樹似槲而皮青葉白，甚光潤，四雙齊高，即如來涅槃處也。
translation: Not far from the river is a sal trees, whose bark resembles mistletoe and their skin is blue-white with white leaves that are very shiny and moistened. The four pairs of these trees are evenly spaced in all directions; this is the place where the Tathāgata entered nirvana.

source_sentence: 有大甎精舍，中有如來涅槃之像，北首而臥。
translation: There was a large brick temple in which there was an image of the Tathāgata’s nirvana, lying with his head toward the north.

source_sentence: 傍有大窣堵波，高二百餘尺，無憂王所造。
translation: Beside it is a great stupa more than two hundred feet high, built by King Aśoka.

source_sentence: 又立石柱記佛涅槃事，不書年月，相傳云：佛處世八十年，以吠舍佉月後半十五日入涅槃，
translation: He also erected a stone pillar to record the details of the Buddha’s nirvana but did not record the years or months. According to tradition, the Buddha lived in the world for eighty years and entered nirvana on the fifteenth day of the second half of the month Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 當此二月十五日。
translation: It's the fifteenth day of the second month here.

source_sentence: 說一切有部復云：佛以迦剌底迦月後半入涅槃，當此九月八日。
translation: Again, the Sarvāstivāda school says: The Buddha entered nirvana on the eighth day of the ninth month corresponding to the second half of the second half-month in Kārttika.

source_sentence: 自涅槃已來，或云千二百歲，或千三百，或千五百，或云過九百未滿千年。
translation: Since the time after nirvana, some say it's been a thousand two hundred years, or a thousand three hundred, or a thousand five hundred, or more than nine hundred less than a thousand years.

source_sentence: 又如來坐金棺為母說法，出臂問阿難，現足示迦葉，香木焚身，八王分骨，
translation: Again, the Tathāgata was seated in a golden coffin to preach the Dharma for his mother. He extended his arm and asked Ānanda what he had said. [The Buddha] showed Kāśyapa by showing him his feet. His body was burned with fragrant wood; the eight kings divided his bones into two:

source_sentence: 皆有塔記。
translation: They all have a stūpa inscription.

source_sentence: 從此復大林中經五百餘里，至婆羅痆斯國(音女點反)。
translation: From here again going through a big forest for more than five hundred li, I reached the country of Vārāṇasī (pronounced “woman’s patch”).

source_sentence: 國周四千餘里，都城西臨殑伽河，長十餘里，廣五六里。
translation: The country is more than four thousand li in circuit and its capital city borders the Ganges River to the west. It is over ten li in length and five or six li in width.

source_sentence: 伽藍三十餘所，僧二千餘人，學小乘一切有部。
translation: There were more than thirty monasteries with over two thousand monks who studied the teachings o f the Sarvastivada school of the Hinayana school.

source_sentence: 渡婆羅痆斯河東北行十餘里，至鹿野伽藍，臺觀連雲，長廊四合。
translation: After crossing the Vārāṇasī River to the northeast for more than ten li, he reached Deer Preserve Monastery. The terraces and pavilions were lined with clouds and the long corridors were arranged in four directions.

source_sentence: 僧徒一千五百人，學小乘正量部。
translation: There were one thousand five hundred monks, all of whom studied the correct teachings of the Hinayana school.

source_sentence: 大院內有精舍，高百餘尺，石階甎龕，層級百數，皆隱起黃金佛像。
translation: Inside the great courtyard there is a temple more than one hundred feet high with stone staircases and brick niches as many as a hundred stories high, all of which are enshrouded by golden images of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 室中有鍮石佛像，量等如來身，作轉法輪狀。
translation: In the chamber there was a carved stone statue of the Buddha, the same size as the Tathāgata’s body, in the shape of turning the wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 精舍東南有石窣堵波，無憂王所建，高百餘尺。
translation: To the southeast of the temple is a stone stupa built by King Aśoka, more than one hundred feet in height.

source_sentence: 前有石柱，高七十餘尺，是佛初轉法輪處。
translation: In front of it was a stone pillar more than seventy feet high, marking the place where the Buddha had first turned the wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 其側有梅怛麗(唐言慈氏，舊曰彌勒，訛也)菩薩受記處。
translation: Beside it was the place where Maitreya (known as Ci in Chinese, formerly transcribed incorrectly as Maitreya in olden times) Bodhisattva received his prediction.

source_sentence: 次西有窣堵波，是佛昔為護明菩薩，於賢劫中人壽二萬歲時，迦葉波佛所受記處。
translation: Next to the west was a stupa built at the place where Kāśyapa Buddha had formerly recorded the assurance of enlightenment for the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra when his life span was twenty thousand years in the Bhadrakalpa.

source_sentence: 釋迦受記南，有過去四佛經行處，長五十餘步，高七尺，以青石積成，
translation: To the south of the place where Śākyamuni had received his prediction is a place where the four past buddhas walked up and down. More than fifty paces long and seven feet in height, it was built of blue stone.

source_sentence: 上有四佛經行之像。
translation: On top of it are images of the four buddhas' sūtras and practices.

source_sentence: 伽藍西有如來澡浴池，又有滌器池，又有浣衣池，並神龍守護，無人穢觸。
translation: To the west of the monastery there is a bathing pond for the Tathāgata. There is another pond for washing alms bowls, as well as another one for washing clothes. All these ponds are guarded by divine dragons and nobody disturbs them.

source_sentence: 池側有窣堵波，佛修菩薩行時，為六牙白象施獵師牙處。
translation: Beside the pond is a stupa built at the place where the Buddha gave his tooth relic bones to a six-tusked white elephant as a hunter when he was engaged in the practice of bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 又為鳥時，與獼猴、白象約尼拘律樹，定長幼巡行化人處。
translation: Also, when he's a bird, he makes an agreement with a rhesus monkey or white elephant about the nyagrodha tree, which is defined as a place where young and old travel to transform people.

source_sentence: 又作鹿王，又度憍陳如等五人處。
translation: He'll also become a deer king, and he'll save the five people like Kauṇḍinya.

source_sentence: 從此順殑伽河流東行三百餘里，至戰主國。
translation: From here going eastward along the Ganges for more than three hundred li, I reached the country of Kaccha.

source_sentence: 從此東北渡殑伽河行百四五十里，至吠舍釐國(舊曰毘舍離，訛)。
translation: From here going northeast for one hundred forty or fifty li over the Ganges, I reached the country of Vaiśālī (formerly known as Vaiśāli).

source_sentence: 國周五千餘里，土壤良沃，多菴沒羅菓茂遮菓。
translation: The country is more than five thousand li in circuit and the soil is good and fertile, with plenty of ambrosia and fruit and plenty of grapes.

source_sentence: 都城荒毀。
translation: The capital city was in ruins.

source_sentence: 故基周六七十里，居人甚少。
translation: The old foundation of the monastery was sixty or seventy li in circuit and very few inhabitants lived there.

source_sentence: 宮城西北五六里有一伽藍，旁有窣堵波，是佛昔說《毘摩羅詰經》處。
translation: Five or six li to the northwest of the palace city was a monastery, beside which was a stupa at the place where the Buddha had preached the Vimalakīrtinirdeśa-sūtra in olden times.

source_sentence: 次東北三四里有窣堵波，是毘摩羅詰故宅，其宅尚多靈異。
translation: Three or four li to the northeast, there is another stupa built at the place where Vimalakīrti’s old residence was converted into a Buddhist monastery with many miraculous features.

source_sentence: 去此不遠有一室，積石所作，是無垢稱現疾說法處。
translation: Not far from here there was a chamber built by piling up stones, which was the place where the Licchavi Vimalakīrti preached the Dharma in his illness.

source_sentence: 其側亦有寶積故宅、菴摩羅女故宅。
translation: Beside it were also the old residences of Ratnacchattra and Ambapālī.

source_sentence: 次北三四里有窣堵波，是佛將往拘尸那國般涅槃，天、人隨從竚立處。
translation: Three or four li further to the north was a stupa built at the place where the Buddha was about to enter final nirvana in the country of Kuśinagara, and the gods and humans followed him.

source_sentence: 次西復有佛最後觀吠舍釐處，次南又有菴摩羅女持園施佛處，又有佛許魔王涅槃處。
translation: Further to the west was the place where the Buddha finally observed Vaiśālī; further to the south was the place where Ambapālī offered a grove to the Buddha, and there was also the place where the Buddha consented to the nirvana of Māra King.

source_sentence: 從吠舍釐南境去殑伽河百餘里，到吠多補羅城，得《菩薩藏經》。
translation: From the southern frontier of Vaiśālī, over one hundred li from the Ganges and reaching the city of Vedapura, he obtained the Bodhisattvapitaka Sutra.

source_sentence: 又南渡殑伽河，至摩揭陀國(舊曰摩伽陀，訛)。
translation: Again to the south, he crossed the Ganges and reached the country of Magadha (formerly transcribed incorrectly asmaghada).

source_sentence: 周五千餘里。
translation: It's more than 5,000 miles in circumference.

source_sentence: 俗土崇學重賢。
translation: The secular land revered learning and valued goodness.

source_sentence: 伽藍五十餘所，僧萬餘人，多大乘學。
translation: There were more than fifty monasteries with over ten thousand monks, most of whom studied Mahayana teachings.

source_sentence: 河南有故城，周七十餘里，雖復荒頹，猶有雉堞。
translation: On the southern side of the river is an old city more than seventy li in circuit. Although it is now in ruins, there are still pheasant turtles and frogs.

source_sentence: 昔人壽無量歲時，號拘蘇摩補羅城(唐言香花宮城)。
translation: In the past, when people's life span was immeasurable years, it was called Kusumapura City (known as the palace city of fragrant flowers in Chinese).

source_sentence: 王宮多花，故致此號。
translation: The king’s palace was full of flowers, so he called it by that name.

source_sentence: 復至人壽數千歲時，更名波吒釐子城(舊曰熙連弗邑，訛)。
translation: When the human life span was several thousand years, it was again called the city of Pāṭaliputra (formerly transcribed incorrectly as Xilanfuyi in olden times).

source_sentence: 復約波吒釐樹為名。
translation: It's also named after the Pāṭaliputra tree.

source_sentence: 至佛涅槃後第一百年，有阿輸迦王(唐言無憂王，舊曰阿育王，訛也)。
translation: In the one hundredth year after the nirvana of the Buddha, there was King Aśoka (known as King Aśoka in Chinese; formerly transcribed incorrectly as King Aśoka).

source_sentence: 即頻毘娑羅王(唐言影堅)之曾孫也，自王舍城遷都來此。
translation: He was the great-grandson of King Bimbisara (known as Yingjian in Chinese) and came here from Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 年代浸遠，今唯故基。
translation: The old foundations have been preserved for a long time but the only thing that remains today is the old foundation.

source_sentence: 伽藍數百，存者二三。
translation: There were several hundred monasteries, two or three of which survived.

source_sentence: 故宮北臨殑伽河為小城，城有千餘家，宮北有石柱高數十尺，無憂王作地獄處。
translation: To the north of the old palace, facing the Ganges River, is a small city with more than one thousand families. To the north of the palace there is a stone pillar, several tens of feet in height, built by King Aśoka as a place of hell.

source_sentence: 法師在小城停七日，巡禮聖迹。
translation: The Master stayed in the small city for seven days and paid his respects to the holy sites.

source_sentence: 地獄南有窣堵波，即八萬四千之一也。
translation: To the south of the hell is a stupa, one of the eighty-four thousand.

source_sentence: 王以人功建立，中有如來舍利一斗，每放神光。
translation: It was built by human effort and contained one sheng of the Tathāgata’s relics, which often issued a divine light.

source_sentence: 次有精舍，舍中有如來所履石，石上有佛雙跡，長一尺八寸，廣六寸，
translation: Next to the stupa is a temple in which there are two traces of the Buddha’s footprints, one foot eight inches long and six inches wide, were preserved.

source_sentence: 兩足下有千輻輪相，十指端有萬字花文及瓶魚等，皎然明著，是如來將入涅槃，
translation: At the base of his feet were one thousand-spoked wheels, and at the ends of their ten fingers were myriad-syllable flower patterns as well as vases, fish, and so on. These were clearly attached to the Tathāgata’s appearance when he was about to enter nirvana.

source_sentence: 發吠舍釐至此，於河南岸大方石上立，顧謂阿難：「此是吾最後望金剛座及王舍城所留之跡也。」
translation: When Vaiśālī arrived here, he stood on a large stone on the southern bank of the river and said to Ānanda, This is the last place where I'll look at the vajra seat and the traces left by Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 精舍北有石柱，高三十餘尺，書記無憂王三以贍部洲施佛、法、僧，三以珍寶贖嗣也。
translation: To the north of the monastery there was a stone pillar more than thirty feet high built at the place where King Aśoka recorded that he had given Jambudvīpa to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha three times for the sake of Jambudvīpa. Three times he redeemed Jambudvīpa with precious treasures as his heir.

source_sentence: 故城東南有屈吒阿濫摩(唐言鷄園)僧伽藍故基，無憂王所造，是召千僧四事供養處。
translation: To the southeast of the old city was the ancient foundations of the Kukkuṭa-āgamama (known as Jiyuan, “Bird’s Park” in Chinese) saṃghārāma Monastery built by King Aśoka. This was the place where one thousand monks were summoned to make offerings for these four requisites.

source_sentence: 是等聖跡，凡停七日，禮拜方遍。
translation: These holy sites remained for seven days and were worshipped everywhere.

source_sentence: 又西南行六七由旬，至低羅磔迦寺。
translation: Again going southwest for six or seven yojanas, the Master reached Kālāmaṅka Monastery.

source_sentence: 寺有三藏數十人，聞法師至，皆出迎引。
translation: There were several tens of Tripitaka Masters in the monastery. When they heard that the Master was arriving, they all came out to greet him.

source_sentence: 從此又南行百餘里，到菩提樹。
translation: From here going southward for more than one hundred li, I reached the bodhi tree.

source_sentence: 樹垣壘甎，高峻極固。
translation: The enclosure of the tree is built of brick, very high and strong.

source_sentence: 東西長，南北稍狹。
translation: It is long from east to west and slightly narrower from south to north.

source_sentence: 正門東對尼連禪河，南門接大花池，西帶嶮固，北門通大伽藍，其內聖跡連接，
translation: The main gate faced the Nairañjanā River to the east; the south gate connected with a large flower pond; the west side was built on a precipitous ridge; and the north gate connected with a great monastery.

source_sentence: 或精舍，或窣堵波，並諸王、大臣、豪富、長者慕聖營造，用為旌記。
translation: Some temples and some stupas were built by the kings, ministers, wealthy people, and wealthy householders in memory of the emperor’s deeds.

source_sentence: 正中有金剛座。
translation: In the main hall, there's the vajra seat.

source_sentence: 賢劫初成，與大地俱起，據三千大千之中，下極金輪，上齊地際，金剛所成，
translation: At the beginning of the world age of the wise one, at the same time as the earth, it is formed together with the trichiliocosm. Within a great chiliocosm, which consists of three thousand:

source_sentence: 周百餘步。
translation: It's more than a hundred paces in circumference.

source_sentence: 言金剛者，取其堅固難壞，能沮萬物。
translation: It's called adamantine because it's so strong and difficult to break down that it can uproot all things.

source_sentence: 若不依本際則地不能停，若不以金剛為座，則無地堪發金剛定。
translation: If he doesn't rely on the original limit, then the ground won't be able to stop, and if he doesn't use the vajra as his seat, then there's no ground that can give rise to the adamantine concentration.

source_sentence: 今欲降魔成道，必居於此，若於餘地，地便傾昃，故賢劫千佛皆就此焉。
translation: Now, if you want to subdue Māra and achieve enlightenment, you must stay here. If you go to another place, the earth will sink; therefore, because a thousand buddhas of the Bhadrakalpa have all stayed here.

source_sentence: 又成道之處亦曰道場，世界傾搖，獨此不動。
translation: It is also called the site of enlightenment. The world tilted and quaked but this place alone remained unmoving.

source_sentence: 一二百年來眾生薄福，往菩提樹不見金剛座。
translation: In the past one or two hundred years, sentient beings with little merit went to the bodhi tree and didn't see the adamantine throne.

source_sentence: 佛涅槃後，諸國王以兩軀觀自在菩薩像南北標界，東向而坐。
translation: After the nirvana of the Buddha, the kings of various countries marked the boundary with two images of Avalokiteśvara Bodhisattva in both bodies to the south and north, facing east and sitting there.

source_sentence: 相傳此菩薩身沒不現，佛法當盡，今南邊菩薩已沒至胸。
translation: It's been said that this bodhisattva's body disappeared and didn't appear, and the Buddha's teaching would end, but now the bodhisattva on the south side has disappeared up to his chest.

source_sentence: 其菩提樹即畢鉢羅樹也，佛在時高數百尺，比頻為惡王誅伐，今可五丈餘，
translation: The tree of enlightenment is the pippala tree. When the Buddha was still alive, he was several hundred feet in height and frequently killed by evil kings. At the present time it is over five zhang high.

source_sentence: 佛坐其下，成無上等覺，因謂菩提樹。
translation: The Buddha sat under it and achieved the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, which is called the bodhi tree.

source_sentence: 樹莖黃白，枝葉青潤，秋冬不凋，唯至如來涅槃日，其葉頓落，經宿還生如本。
translation: The stems of the trees are yellowish white in color and their leaves are green and moistened; they do not wither in autumn or winter. On the day on which the Tathāgata is about to enter nirvana, however, the leaves suddenly fall off and grow back as before during the night.

source_sentence: 每至是日，諸國王與臣僚共集樹下，以乳灌洗，燃燈散花，收葉而去。
translation: On that day the kings of various countries and their officials assembled at the foot of a tree to wash themselves with milk, lighted lamps, scattered flowers, collected leaves, and departed.

source_sentence: 法師至，禮菩提樹及慈氏菩薩所作成道時像，至誠瞻仰訖，五體投地，
translation: When the Master arrived, he bowed to the enlightenment tree of enlightenment and the statues made by Maitreya Bodhisattva. After venerating them with utmost sincerity, he prostrated himself on the ground five-legged.

source_sentence: 悲哀懊惱，自傷歎言：「佛成道時，不知漂淪何趣。
translation: Being overcome with sorrow and distress, he grieved and lamented, saying, “At the time of the Buddha’s attainment of enlightenment I did not know where I was floating in the sea.

source_sentence: 今於像季方乃至斯。」
translation: Now, it's only now that the season of the image is approaching its end.

source_sentence: 緬惟業障一何深重，悲淚盈目。
translation: What's the deepest of the karmic hindrances that I've contemplated, and my eyes are filled with sad tears.

source_sentence: 時逢眾僧解夏，遠近輻湊數千人，觀者無不鳴噎。
translation: When he met with a group of monks on the summer retreat, thousands of people from near and far gathered at his monastery, and none of those who saw him cried out in tears.

source_sentence: 其處一踰繕那聖跡充滿，停八九日，禮拜方遍。
translation: The place was filled with holy sites one yojana in size and remained there for eight days or nine days, worshipping them all.

source_sentence: 至第十日，那爛陀寺眾差四大德來迎，即與同去。
translation: On the tenth day, the four great virtuous monks of Nalanda Monastery came to greet him and they departed together.

source_sentence: 行可七踰繕那至寺莊。
translation: He traveled for about seven yojanas to the temple.

source_sentence: 莊是尊者目連本生之村。
translation: Zhuang is the village where Venerable Maudgalyāyana was originally born.

source_sentence: 至莊食，須臾，更有二百餘僧與千餘檀越將幢蓋、花香復來迎引，讚歎圍繞入那爛陀。
translation: In a moment, as soon as the food was prepared, more than two hundred monks and over one thousand donors, with banners, canopies, flowers, and incense, came to greet him again and praised his surrounded entry into Nāranda.

source_sentence: 既至，合眾都集。
translation: When he arrived, they all gathered together.

source_sentence: 法師共相見訖，於上座頭別安床，命法師坐，徒眾亦坐。
translation: When they had met each other, the Master arranged a separate seat at the head of the superior monk and instructed him to take his seat. All the monks in the assembly were also seated.

source_sentence: 坐訖，遣維那擊犍稚唱。
translation: After he had sat down, he sent Vaiśravaṇa to strike the gandharva and sing.

source_sentence: 法師住寺，寺中一切僧所畜用法物道具咸皆共同。
translation: The Master stayed at a monastery, where all the monks in the monastery stored the Dharma articles and implements they used together.

source_sentence: 仍差二十人非老非少、閑解經律、威儀齊整者，將法師參正法藏，即戒賢法師也，
translation: He appointed twenty disciples, neither old nor young, who were well versed in the scriptures and disciplinary rules and their proper demeanor. The Master was invited to study the doctrine of the Tripitaka Master, namely, the Dharma Master Silabhadra.

source_sentence: 眾共尊重不斥其名，號為正法藏。
translation: The whole community honored him and didn't reject his name, calling him the store of the right teaching.

source_sentence: 於是隨眾入謁。
translation: He then followed the crowd and entered to see him.

source_sentence: 既見，方事師資，務盡其敬，依彼儀式，膝行肘步，嗚足頂禮，問訊讚歎訖。
translation: When they saw him, they paid their respects to the Master and served him. In accordance with the proper ceremony, they knelt on their knees and elbows, saluted him by bowing their foreheads at his feet, greeted him, and praised him.

source_sentence: 法藏令廣敷床座，命法師及諸僧坐。
translation: The Dharma Store told him to spread out a wide bed and seat and ordered the Master and the other monks to sit there.

source_sentence: 坐訖，問法師從何處來？
translation: After he had taken his seat, he asked the Master where he came from.

source_sentence: 報曰：「從支那國來，欲依師學《瑜伽論》。」
translation: He replied, I came from China and wanted to rely on my teacher to study the Yogâcārabhūmi-śāstra.

source_sentence: 聞已啼泣，喚弟子佛陀跋陀羅(唐言覺賢)，即法藏之姪也，年七十餘，
translation: Having heard these words he wept and called his disciple Buddhabhadra (known as Juexian in Chinese, “Enlightened One”), a nephew of the Tripitaka Master, over seventy years old.

source_sentence: 博通經論，善於言談。
translation: He was well versed in both scriptures and treatises and was skilled in rhetoric.

source_sentence: 法藏語曰：「汝可為眾說我三年前病惱因緣。」
translation: The Dharma store said, You may explain the causes and conditions of my illness and distress three years ago for the sake of the crowd.

source_sentence: 覺賢聞已，啼泣捫淚而說昔緣云：「和上昔患風病，每發，手足拘急如火燒刀刺之痛，
translation: Having heard this, the venerable one wept in tears and told the story of his past illness. The brahman was suffering from a wind sickness that frequently broke in his hands and feet as if he were being burned by fire or with a knife inflicting pain.

source_sentence: 乍發乍息，凡二十餘載。
translation: It had been more than twenty years since it began and ceased.

source_sentence: 去三年前，苦痛尤甚，厭惡此身，欲不食取盡。
translation: Three years ago, the pain and suffering were so great that they became disgusted with this body and wished not to eat it up.

source_sentence: 於夜中夢三天人，一黃金色，二琉璃色，三白銀色，形貌端正，儀服輕明，
translation: In the middle of the night he dreamt of a celestial being of three colors, one golden in color, two lapis lazuli-colored, and three silver-colored.

source_sentence: 來問和上曰：『汝欲棄此身耶？
translation: He came and asked the monk, 'Do you want to abandon this body?'

source_sentence: 經云：「說身有苦，不說厭離於身。」
translation: The sūtra says, It's said that the body is painful, but it's not said to be disillusioned with leaving the body.

source_sentence: 汝於過去曾作國王，多惚眾生，故招此報。
translation: You were once a king in the past and frequently deceived sentient beings, so you've incurred this retribution.

source_sentence: 今宜觀省宿愆，至誠懺悔，於苦安忍，勤宣經論，自當銷滅。
translation: You should now examine the matter of your past misdeeds and repent with sincerity. Forbear suffering, exhort us to expound the scriptures and commentaries so as to eradicate them for yourself.

source_sentence: 直爾厭身，苦終不盡。』
translation: It's just that I'm disillusioned with my body, and the suffering won't end.'

source_sentence: 和上聞已，至誠禮拜。
translation: Having heard this, Venerable Vātsīputrīya venerated him with sincerity.

source_sentence: 其金色人指碧色者語和上曰：『汝識不？
translation: The golden-colored man with blue fingers said to the monk, 'Do you know?'

source_sentence: 此是觀自在菩薩。』
translation: This is the Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva.'

source_sentence: 又指銀色曰：『此是慈氏菩薩。』
translation: He also pointed to the silver and said, 'This is the Maitreya Bodhisattva.'

source_sentence: 和上即禮拜慈氏，問曰：『戒賢常願生於尊處，不知得不？』
translation: The monk then paid homage to Maitreya and asked, 'Pāli always wished to be born in the venerable place, but didn't he know?'

source_sentence: 報曰：『汝廣傳正法，後當得生。』
translation: He replied, 'Explain the right teaching widely, and you'll be born later.'

source_sentence: 金色者自言：『我是曼殊室利菩薩。
translation: The golden-colored one said to himself, 'I am Mañjuśrī Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 我等見汝空欲捨身，不為利益，故來勸汝。
translation: We see that you want to abandon your body in vain, and we don't want to benefit you; therefore, we come to encourage you.

source_sentence: 當依我語，顯揚正法《瑜伽論》等，遍及未聞，汝身即漸安隱，勿憂不差。
translation: You should rely on my words to express the true teaching, such as the Yogâcārabhūmi-śāstra and so forth, which you have never heard before. Your body will be gradually at ease, without sorrow or discomfort.

source_sentence: 有支那國僧樂通大法，欲就汝學，汝可待教之。』
translation: There's a Chinese monk who enjoys the great teaching and wants to teach it to you, so you can wait and teach him.'

source_sentence: 法藏聞已，禮拜報曰：『敬依尊教。』
translation: After hearing this, the Dharma Store paid homage and replied, 'I respectfully rely on the venerable teaching.'

source_sentence: 言已不見。
translation: He said he hadn't seen it.

source_sentence: 自爾已來，和上所苦瘳除。」
translation: Since then, the monk's suffering and anguish have been removed.

source_sentence: 僧眾聞者莫不稱歎希有。
translation: The saṃgha heard this and all praised it as rare.

source_sentence: 法師得親承斯記，悲喜不能自勝，更禮謝曰：「若如所說，玄奘當盡力聽習，
translation: Having personally heard these words, the Master was overcome with grief and joy and could not control himself. He again paid his respects to the monk and said, “If it is as you say, I shall do my utmost to hear and study it.

source_sentence: 願尊慈悲攝受教誨。」
translation: May the Venerable compassionate take in the teachings.

source_sentence: 法藏又問：「法師汝在路幾年？」
translation: Again, the Dharma Store asked, Master, how many years have you been on the road?

source_sentence: 答：「三年。」
translation: Answer, Three years.

source_sentence: 既與昔夢符同，種種誨喻令法師歡喜，以申師弟之情。
translation: Since it's the same as the past dream talisman, he gave various instructions and metaphors to make the Master rejoice in order to express his feelings of teacher and disciple.

source_sentence: 言訖辭出，向幼日王院安置於覺賢房第四重閣。
translation: Having said so, he departed and was lodged in the fourth storeyed pavilion of the house of the enlightened one at the court of the king of the younger days.

source_sentence: 七日供養已，更安置上房在護法菩薩房北，加諸供給。
translation: After seven days of offerings, he was again lodged in the upper room to the north of the Dharmapāla's room and added offerings.

source_sentence: 日得贍步羅菓一百二十枚，檳榔子二十顆，豆蔻二十顆，龍腦香一兩，
translation: Every day he obtained one hundred and twenty kinds of Jambudvīpa fruits, twenty kinds of grapes, twenty kinds of beans and grapes, and one tael of the fragrance of a dragon’s hair.

source_sentence: 供大人米一升。
translation: He offered a sheng of rice to the great man.

source_sentence: 其米大於烏豆，作飯香鮮，餘米不及，唯摩揭陀國有此粳米，餘處更無，
translation: The rice is larger than that of millet and makes a fragrant rice dish, but the rest are not as good as this. Only the country of Magadha produces this kind of millet; elsewhere it is absent.

source_sentence: 獨供國王及多聞大德，故號為供大人米。
translation: He was the only one who offered rice to the king and well-versed great virtuous monks, so he was called an offering of rice to the great men.

source_sentence: 月給油三升，酥乳等隨日取足。
translation: He gave three sheng of oil a month and took the amount of butter, milk, and so on, as much as he needed each day.

source_sentence: 淨人一人、婆羅門一人，免諸僧事，行乘象輿。
translation: A pure man and a brāhmaṇa, accompanied by one monk and one brahman, traveled on an elephant-drawn carriage to avoid the affairs of the Sangha.

source_sentence: 那爛陀寺主客萬，僧預此供給添法師合有十人。
translation: At Nalanda Monastery there were ten thousand monks, all of whom were invited by the saṃgha to make offerings to the Master.

source_sentence: 其遊踐殊方，見禮如此。
translation: He traveled to different places and paid his respects in this way.

source_sentence: 那爛陀寺者，此云施無厭寺。
translation: Nalanda Monastery is the Sanskrit word for a monastery that doesn't tire of giving.

source_sentence: 耆舊相傳，此伽藍南菴沒羅園中有池，池有龍名那爛陀，傍建伽藍，故以為號。
translation: According to an old tradition, there was a pond in the mango grove to the south of this monastery. In the pond there was a dragon named Nāraṇḍa whose name was Nāraṇḍa; it was built beside the pond to house the monastery and is therefore called by that name.

source_sentence: 又云是如來昔行菩薩道時，為大國王建都此地，憐愍孤窮，常行惠捨，
translation: It is also said that when the Tathāgata was practicing the path of enlightening beings in the past, he built a capital city at this place for the sake of the great king. He had compassion for the orphaned and the helpless and always practiced charity.

source_sentence: 物念其恩，故號其處為施無厭也。
translation: Because things are mindful of their kindness, they're called that place because they don't tire of giving.

source_sentence: 地本菴沒羅長者園，五百商人以十億金錢買以施佛，佛於此處三月說法，
translation: The land was originally the park of the wealthy man Anavatapta, and five hundred merchants purchased it for one billion coins to offer it to the Buddha. At this place the Buddha preached the Dharma for three months.

source_sentence: 商人多有證果。
translation: Many merchants had realized the fruit.

source_sentence: 佛涅槃後，此國先王鑠迦羅阿迭多(唐言帝日)敬戀佛故，造此伽藍。
translation: After the nirvāṇa of the Buddha, a former king of this country named Kauṣṭhiladitya (known as Indra in Chinese) built this monastery out of respect for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 王崩後，其子佛陀毱多王(唐言覺護)纂承鴻業，次南又造伽藍。
translation: After the demise of the king, his son, King Buddhagupta (known as Juehou in Chinese) compiled a collection of great works and built another monastery to the south.

source_sentence: 至子怛他揭多王(唐言如來)，次東又造伽藍。
translation: Zhixi, the king of Uttaragata (known as Tathāgata in Chinese), built another monastery to the east.

source_sentence: 至子婆羅阿迭多(唐言幼日)，次東北又建伽藍。
translation: Zhixi, Vārāṇasī (known as Young Sun in Chinese), built another monastery to the northeast.

source_sentence: 後見聖僧從此支那國往赴其供，心生歡喜，捨位出家。
translation: Later, seeing the holy monks coming from this country of China to make offerings to them, he became delighted and renounced his throne and renounced household life.

source_sentence: 其子伐闍羅(唐言金剛)嗣位，次北又建伽藍。
translation: When his son Vajra (known as Jingang in Chinese) ascended the throne, he built another monastery to the north.

source_sentence: 其後中印度王於側又造伽藍。
translation: Later, the king of Central India built another monastery beside it.

source_sentence: 如是六帝相承，各加營造，又以甎壘其外，合為一寺，都建一門。
translation: Thus, each of the six emperors inherited the other castes and built a new one. The brick walls on the outside were combined into one temple with one gate for all to see.

source_sentence: 庭序別開，中分八院。
translation: The courtyard was divided into eight courts in the middle, each with a separate entrance.

source_sentence: 寶臺星列，瓊樓岳峙，觀竦烟中，殿飛霞上，生風雲於戶牖，交日月於軒簷，
translation: The jeweled terrace was arrayed with stars in the sky, and the towers were built of jade. A lofty mountain range rose high above the smoke from the chim­ ings; the hall flew up into the clouds on the top of the palace’s ceiling, producing clouds of wind blowing from the door windows as well as moons and suns

source_sentence: 加以淥水逶迤，青蓮菡萏，羯尼花樹暉煥其間，菴沒羅林森疎其外。
translation: It is surrounded by blue lotus blossoms and khaṭṭṭika trees, and the forest of uncultivated mango trees extends beyond it.

source_sentence: 諸院僧室皆四重重閣，虬棟虹梁，繡櫨朱柱，彫楹鏤檻，玉礎文[木*((奐-大)\/比)]，
translation: The monastic chambers of the monasteries were all four-story multistoried pavilions, built of brick and beams embellished with embroidered silk pillars, carved with engraved pillars and chiseled with thresholds.

source_sentence: 甍接瑤暉，榱連繩彩。
translation: The carriages are decorated with the colors of yogâcārabhūmi and draped with cords.

source_sentence: 印度伽藍數乃千萬，壯麗崇高，此為其極。
translation: In India there were thousands of monasteries, but this was the most magnificent and sublime of them all.

source_sentence: 僧徒主客常有萬人，並學大乘兼十八部，爰至俗典《吠陀》等書，因明、聲明、醫方、術數亦俱研習。
translation: There were always ten thousand monks and guest monks, all of whom studied Mahayana teachings and the eighteen other scriptures as well as secular texts such as the Vedas. They studied logic, grammar, physiognomy, medicine, and mathematics at the same time.

source_sentence: 凡解經、論二十部者一千餘人，三十部者五百餘人，五十部者并法師十人。
translation: There were more than 1,000 people who understood the twenty texts of the scriptures and treatises, over five hundred people who understood the thirty texts, and ten people who understood the fifty texts together with the Master.

source_sentence: 唯戒賢法師一切窮覽，德秀年耆，為眾宗匠。
translation: Only the Master Silabhadra was thoroughly versed in all the texts; virtuous scholars of old age were the teachers of the Sangha.

source_sentence: 寺內講座日百餘所，學徒修習，無棄寸陰。
translation: There were more than a hundred lecture halls in the monastery. All the monks and students studied at these halls without neglecting the one-inch scriptures.

source_sentence: 德眾所居，自然嚴肅。
translation: The residences of the virtuous monks and nuns are naturally solemn.

source_sentence: 建立已來七百餘載，未有一人犯譏過者。
translation: For more than seven hundred years since its establishment, there hasn't been a single person who violates the rules and criticizes them.

source_sentence: 國王欽重，捨百餘邑充其供養，邑二百戶，日進粳米、酥乳數百石。
translation: The king esteemed it and gave more than a hundred villages to make offerings to it. These villages had two hundred families living in them, and every day they offered millet, rice, butter, and milk amounting to several hundred sheep’s worth of grain per day.

source_sentence: 由是學人端拱無求而四事自足，藝業成就，斯其力焉。
translation: As a result, the students were self-sufficient in all four affairs without seeking anything. It was because of their power that they mastered arts and crafts.

source_sentence: 法師於那爛陀寺安置已，向王舍城觀禮聖迹。
translation: After the Master had been lodged in Nalanda Monastery, he went to the city of Rājagṛha to pay his respects to the holy sites.

source_sentence: 王舍舊城彼云矩奢揭羅補羅城(唐言上茅宮城)，城處摩揭陀國之中，
translation: The old city of Rājagṛha (known as Kuśinagarapura City) is situated in the country of Magadha.

source_sentence: 古昔君王多住其內。
translation: In the ancient past, many rulers lived there.

source_sentence: 其地又生好香茅，故取為稱。
translation: That land also produces good-smelling thatch, so it's called that.

source_sentence: 四面皆山，峻峭如削，西通小徑，北有大門，東西長，南北狹，周一百五十餘里。
translation: The four sides are all mountains, as steep and precipitous as if they were carved. There is a minor path leading to the west and a big gate leading to the north. It is long from east to west and narrow from south to north; it is more than one hundred fifty li in circuit.

source_sentence: 其內更有小城，基周三十餘里，羯尼迦樹處處成林，發蕚開榮，四時無間，
translation: Inside it is a small city more than thirty li in circumference, built of khaṇika trees growing forests at different places. It produces grapes and flowers that bloom without interruption on all four seasons.

source_sentence: 葉如金色。
translation: The leaves are like golden color.

source_sentence: 宮城北門外有窣堵波，是提婆達多與未生怨王放護財醉象欲害佛處。
translation: Outside the north gate of the palace city is a stupa built at the place where Devadatta and King Ajātaśatru released wealthy, drunken elephants intoxicated with desire to harm the Buddha.

source_sentence: 此東北有窣堵波，是舍利子聞阿濕婆恃苾芻說法證果處。
translation: To the northeast of here is a stupa at the place where Śāriputra attained enlightenment by listening to the Dharma preached by Aśvajit.

source_sentence: 次北不遠有大深坑，是室利毱多(唐言勝密)受外道邪言，以火坑、毒飯欲害佛處。
translation: Next, not far to the north, there's a great deep pit that's where Śāriputra (known as Vaiśeṣika in Chinese) received the wrong words of non-Buddhists and intended to harm the Buddha with a fire pit and poisonous rice.

source_sentence: 次火坑東北山城之曲有窣堵波，是時縛迦大醫(舊曰耆婆，訛也)於此為佛造說法堂處。
translation: Next, to the northeast of the fire pit, at a corner of the mountain city, is a stupa built at the place where the great physician Bhagavān (formerly transcribed incorrectly as Jīvaka) built a preaching hall for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 其側現有時縛迦故宅。
translation: Beside it, there's the old house of Śākyamuni when he was still alive.

source_sentence: 宮城東北行十四五里，至姞栗陀羅矩吒山(唐言鷲峰，亦云鷲臺，舊曰耆闍崛山，
translation: Going to the northeast from the palace city for fourteen or fifteen li, I reached Upagupta Mountain (known as Vulture Peak in Chinese and Vulture Terrace in olden times; formerly known as Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa).

source_sentence: 訛也)。
translation: It's also a mistake.)

source_sentence: 其山連崗北嶺，隆崛特高，形如鷲鳥，又狀高臺，故取為稱。
translation: The mountain is connected with the northern peak of the Pamir Range, which is so lofty and high that it resembles an eagle-winged bird and has the shape of a raised terrace. For this reason it is called Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 泉石清奇，林樹森欝，如來在世多居此山說《法華》、《大般若》等無量眾經。
translation: The springs and rocks are marvelous and the forests and trees are luxuriant. When the Tathāgata was living in the world, he often stayed on this mountain to expound immeasurable collections of scriptures such as the Lotus Sutra and Mahaprajnaparamita Sutra.

source_sentence: 山城北門行一里餘，至迦蘭陀竹園，今現有甎室，如來在昔多居其中，
translation: Going from the northern gate of the hill city for more than one li, he reached the Kalandaka Bamboo Grove, where there was still a brick chamber in which the Tathagata lived.

source_sentence: 制諸戒律。
translation: They regulate the precepts and vinaya.

source_sentence: 園主名迦蘭陀，先以此園施諸外道。
translation: The owner of the park was named Kalandaka, and he first gave this park to non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 後見佛，又聞深法，恨不以園得施如來。
translation: Later, when he saw the Buddha and heard the profound Dharma again, he resented not giving the garden to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 時地神知其意，為現災怪怖諸外道，逐之令出，告曰：「長者欲以園施佛，
translation: Knowing what he wished, the earth goddess was terrified and frightened by the disaster. The heretics expelled him and told him, “Householder, you wish to offer the garden to the Buddha!

source_sentence: 汝宜速去。」
translation: It's better for you to leave quickly.

source_sentence: 外道含怒而出。
translation: The non-Buddhist contains anger and comes out.

source_sentence: 長者歡喜，建立精舍訖，躬往請佛，佛為受之。
translation: The wealthy man was delighted. Having completed the construction of the monastery, he went in person and invited the Buddha to receive it for him.

source_sentence: 竹園東有窣堵波，阿闍多設咄路王(唐言未生怨，舊曰阿闍世，訛也)之所建。
translation: To the east of the bamboo grove is a stupa built by King Ajātaśatru (known as Yushengren in Chinese; formerly transcribed incorrectly as Ajashi erroneously).

source_sentence: 如來涅槃後，諸王共分舍利，未生怨王得已將歸，立塔供養。
translation: After the nirvana of the Tathāgata, the kings shared the relics with each other. The enemy king who had not yet arisen and was about to return when he obtained them, built a stupa for their veneration.

source_sentence: 無憂王發心欲遍造諸塔，開取舍利，尚留少許，今每放光明。
translation: King Aśoka wished to build all the stupas everywhere, but when he opened them and took out the relics, they remained for a little while. They now often emitted light.

source_sentence: 竹園西南行五六里，山側有別竹林，中有大石室，是尊者摩訶迦葉波於此與九百九十九大阿羅漢，
translation: At a distance of five or six li to the southwest of the bamboo grove there is another bamboo grove beside the mountain. Beside it is a large stone chamber in which Venerable Mahākāśyapa was staying together with ninety-nine hundred and twenty-nine arhats.

source_sentence: 如來涅槃後結集三藏處。
translation: After the Tathāgata's nirvāṇa, he compiled the Tripiṭaka of the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 當結集時，無量聖眾雲集，迦葉告曰：「眾中自知具三明、六通，總持如來一切法藏無錯謬者住，
translation: At the time of the assembly, an infinite multitude of holy monks had assembled in great numbers. Kāśyapa said to them: The members of the assembly know that they are endowed with the three knowledges and the six supernatural powers, which enable them to preserve all the teachings of the Tathāgata without error.

source_sentence: 餘各隨所安。」
translation: The rest follow where they're settled.

source_sentence: 時簡得九百九十九人。
translation: At the time, there were 9,99 people who simply attained it.

source_sentence: 阿難在於學地，迦葉語阿難：「汝漏未盡，勿污清眾。」
translation: When Ānanda was at the stage of training, Kāśyapa said to Ānanda, You haven't ended the contaminants; don't defile the pure crowd.

source_sentence: 阿難慚愧而出。
translation: Ānanda was ashamed and left.

source_sentence: 一夜勤修，斷三界結，成阿羅漢，還來叩門。
translation: He cultivated it diligently for one night, cut off the bonds of the three worlds, became an arhat, and came back to knock at the door.

source_sentence: 迦葉問曰：「汝結盡耶？」
translation: Kāśyapa asked, Have you ended the bonds?

source_sentence: 答曰：「然！」
translation: He replied, Yes!

source_sentence: 復曰：「若結盡者，不勞開門，隨意所入。」
translation: Again, he said, If the bonds are exhausted, don't bother to open the door and enter as you wish.

source_sentence: 阿難乃從戶隙而入，禮拜僧足。
translation: Ānanda then entered through the door and venerated the monk’s feet.

source_sentence: 迦葉執其手曰：「我欲汝除斷諸漏證聖果，故驅逐汝出，汝當知之。
translation: Kāśyapa held his hand and said, I want you to remove the contaminants and realize the noble fruit so I will drive you out. You should know this.

source_sentence: 勿以為恨。」
translation: Don't think it's a grudge.

source_sentence: 阿難曰：「若懷恨者，豈名結盡。」
translation: Ānanda said, If someone harbors hatred, isn't it called the end of the bond?

source_sentence: 於是禮謝而坐。
translation: He then paid his respects and sat down.

source_sentence: 即初安居十五日時也。
translation: It's the fifteenth day of the first retreat.

source_sentence: 迦葉語阿難曰：「如來常於眾中稱汝多聞，總持諸法，汝可昇座為眾誦《素呾纜藏》，
translation: Kāśyapa said to Ānanda: The Tathāgata always praised you in the assembly as well-versed and upholding all the teachings. You may ascend your seat and recite the sutra scriptures for the sake of the assembly.

source_sentence: 即一切經也。」
translation: That's all the sūtras.

source_sentence: 阿難承命而起，向佛般涅槃山方作禮訖，昇坐誦經，諸眾隨口而錄。
translation: Ānanda rose and, in accordance with his instruction, proceeded to the Buddha’s parinirvana mountain. Having paid homage before he did so, he ascended to his seat to recite the scripture. All the monks recorded it as they wished.

source_sentence: 錄訖，又命優波離誦《毘柰耶藏》，即一切戒律也。
translation: Upon completion of the record, Upāli was also instructed to recite the Vinaya Pitaka, which contained all the precepts.

source_sentence: 誦訖，迦葉波自誦《阿毘達磨藏》，即一切論議。
translation: When the recitation was over, Kāśyapa recited the Abhidharma piṭaka for himself, that is, all the treatises and discussions.

source_sentence: 經兩三月安居中集三藏訖，書之貝葉方遍流通。
translation: Two or three months after he had collected the Tripiṭaka in his retreat, he wrote it down on a seashell leaf and circulated it everywhere.

source_sentence: 諸聖相謂曰：「我等集此，名報佛恩，今日得聞，斯其力也。」
translation: The sages said, We've gathered here to repay the Buddha's kindness, and today we've heard it; this is its power.

source_sentence: 以大迦葉僧中上座，因名上座部。
translation: Because he was the superior seat among the great Kāśyapa monks, he's called the superior seat group.

source_sentence: 又此西二十里有窣堵波，無憂王所建，即大眾部共集之處。
translation: Twenty li to the west of here is another stupa built by King Aśoka at the place where the Mahasamghika school held a common assembly.

source_sentence: 諸學、無學數千人，大迦葉結集時不預者，共集此中，更相謂曰：「如來在日，
translation: Hundreds of thousands of people, both those who had more to learn and those who did not, assembled here together at the time of Mahākāśyapa’s assembly. They said among themselves:

source_sentence: 同一師學。
translation: They all studied under the same teacher.

source_sentence: 世尊滅度，驅簡我等，我等豈不能結集法藏報佛恩耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān has entered nirvāṇa and expelled us, so why wouldn't we gather the Dharma store to repay the Buddha's kindness?

source_sentence: 復集《素怛纜藏》、《毘柰耶藏》、《阿毘達磨藏》、《雜集藏》、《禁呪藏》，
translation: He also compiled the Sutra Treasury, the Vinaya Treasury, the Abhidharma Treasury, the Miscellaneous Treasury, and the forbidden spell treasury.

source_sentence: 別為五藏，此中凡、聖同會，因謂之大眾部。
translation: The five collections are separately called the Sangha, where ordinary and holy monks assembly together; hence it is called the Sangha.

source_sentence: 次東北三四里至曷羅闍姞利呬多城(唐言王舍城)。
translation: Three or four li to the northeast, he reached the city of Rājagṛha (known as Wangsā City in Chinese).

source_sentence: 外郭已壞，內城猶峻，周二十餘里，面有一門。
translation: The outer walls have been demolished but the inner walls are still steep, more than twenty li in circumference. There is a gate on each side of the wall.

source_sentence: 初頻毘娑羅王居上茅宮時，百姓殷稠，居家鱗接。
translation: At the time when King Bimbisāra lived in the upper thatched palace, the people were so dense that they lived at home.

source_sentence: 數遭火災，乃立嚴制，有不謹慎，先失火者，徙之寒林。
translation: They frequently encountered the calamity of fire and established strict rules. Those who were not careful before they lost the fire were driven to live in a cold forest.

source_sentence: 寒林即彼國棄屍惡處也。
translation: The cold forest is the bad place to abandon a corpse in that country.

source_sentence: 頃之，王宮忽復失火。
translation: Soon after, the king’s palace suddenly caught fire again.

source_sentence: 王曰：「我為人主，自犯不行，無以懲下。」
translation: The king said, I'm the lord of men, and there's no way to punish myself for violating it.

source_sentence: 命太子留撫，王徙居寒林。
translation: He ordered the prince to stay behind, and the king moved to live in the cold forest.

source_sentence: 時吠舍釐王聞頻婆娑羅野居於外，欲簡兵襲之。
translation: When the king of Vaiśālī heard that Bimbisara was living outside in the wilderness, he wanted to send his troops to attack him.

source_sentence: 候望者知而奏，王乃築邑。
translation: Knowing this, the attendants of the monastery reported it to the king, who built an enclosure.

source_sentence: 以王先舍於此，故名王舍城，即新城也。
translation: Because the king had previously lived in this monastery, it is called the City of Rājagṛha (i.e., the New City).

source_sentence: 後闍王嗣位，因都之。
translation: Afterward the king Ajātaśatru succeeded to the throne and made it his capital.

source_sentence: 至無憂王遷都波吒釐，以城施婆羅門。
translation: When King Aśoka moved his capital to Kapoṭaliputra, he gave the city to the brahmans.

source_sentence: 今城中無雜人，唯婆羅門千餘家耳。
translation: There are no mixed people in the city today, but there are only a thousand brahman families.

source_sentence: 宮城內西南隅有窣堵波，是殊底色迦長者故宅(唐言星曆，舊云樹提伽，
translation: In the southwest corner of the palace city there is a stupa built at the place where the old residence of the householder Jyotiṣka (known in Chinese as Shanli, formerly transcribed as Jyotiṣka) lived.

translation: It's a mistake), and there's also the place where he crossed over to Rāhula (i.e., the Buddha's son).

source_sentence: 那爛陀寺西北有大精舍，高三百餘尺，婆羅阿迭多王之所建也。
translation: To the northwest of Nalanda Monastery is a great temple more than three hundred feet in height built by King Varaditya.

source_sentence: 莊嚴甚麗，其中佛像同菩提樹像。
translation: The stupas are beautifully adorned and all contain buddha images the same as those of the bodhi tree.

source_sentence: 精舍東北有窣堵波，如來昔於此七日說法處。
translation: To the northeast of the monastery is a stupa at the place where the Tathāgata once preached the Dharma for seven days.

source_sentence: 西北又有過去四佛坐處。
translation: To the northwest, there are also places where the four past buddhas sat.

source_sentence: 其南鍮石精舍，戒日王之所建，功雖未畢，詳其圖量，限高十餘丈。
translation: To the south was a brick stone shrine built by King Siladitya. Although it had not completed its construction before, the size of this stone shrine was limited to more than ten feet in height.

source_sentence: 城次東二百餘步有銅立佛像，高八十餘尺，重閣六層方得覆及，昔滿胄王之所作也。
translation: More than two hundred paces to the east of the city is a standing bronze statue of the Buddha, more than eighty feet in height. Covered only by six-story multistoried pavilions, which were built by King Pūrṇapura in olden times.

source_sentence: 又東行數里有窣堵波，佛初成道向王舍城至此，頻毘娑羅王與國人百千萬眾迎見佛處。
translation: A few li to the east was a stupa built at the place where King Bimbisara and hundreds of thousands of his subjects, accompanied by hundreds of millions of people, greeted the Buddha.

source_sentence: 又東行三十餘里，至因陀羅勢羅窶訶山。
translation: Again going eastward for more than thirty li, he reached the mountain of Indrasailaohita.

source_sentence: 東峰伽藍前有窣堵波，謂僧(斯贈反)娑(唐言雁也)。
translation: In front of the monastery on the east peak is a stupa named Saṃsāra (known as “goose” in Chinese).

source_sentence: 昔此伽藍依小乘漸教，食三淨肉，於一時中買贖不得，其檢校人傍偟無措，
translation: Formerly this monastery ate the three kinds of pure meat in accordance with the gradual teachings of the Hinayana school, but at one time it was not offered for sale.

source_sentence: 乃見群雁翔飛，仰而戲言曰：「今日僧供有闕，摩訶薩埵宜知是時。」
translation: Seeing the flock of geese flying, he looked up and said, Today, there's a deficiency in the offerings for the saṃgha, so it's advisable to know this.

source_sentence: 言訖，其引前者應聲而迴，鎩翮高雲，投身自墜。
translation: When he finished speaking, the one who led them before him turned back in response to his voice and flew up into a high cloud that dropped down on its own.

source_sentence: 苾芻見已慚懼，遍告眾僧，聞者驚嗟，無不對之歎泣。
translation: Seeing this, the monk was ashamed and frightened, telling the whole group of monks, who were terrified when they heard it and wept in admiration.

source_sentence: 各相謂曰：「此菩薩也。
translation: They each said to each other, “This is the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 我曹何人，敢欲噉食。
translation: Who would dare to eat me?

source_sentence: 又如來設教，漸次而防，我等執彼初誘之言，便為究竟之說，守愚無改，
translation: Furthermore, the Tathāgata teaches gradually and gradually so as to prevent error. We hold to the initial words of those who seduce others but then explain the ultimate truth for them, thereby preserving ignorance without changing it.

source_sentence: 致此損傷。
translation: It causes this damage.

source_sentence: 自今已後，宜依大乘，不得更食三淨。」
translation: From now on, it's advisable to rely on the great vehicle and not eat the three pure things again.

source_sentence: 仍建靈塔，以死雁埋中，題表其心，使永傳芳烈，以故有茲塔也。
translation: He built a sacred stupa and buried the dead goose in it. The title of the stupa expressed his thoughts, so as to perpetually convey the fragrance of his virtue. This is why this stupa exists.

source_sentence: 如是等聖迹，法師皆周遍觀禮訖。
translation: Such holy sites as these the Master visited and worshipped all around him.

source_sentence: 還歸那爛陀寺，方請戒賢法師講《瑜伽論》，同聽者數千人。
translation: He returned to Nalanda Monastery and invited the Master Silabhadra to lecture on the Yogacarabhumi Sastra, with several thousand people in attendance.

source_sentence: 開題訖，少時，有一婆羅門於眾外悲[口*睪]而復言笑。
translation: Soon after he had opened the title, a Brāhmaṇa lamented [mouthing*tastic] and laughed out loudly outside the crowd.

source_sentence: 遣人問其所以。
translation: He sent someone to ask him why.

source_sentence: 答言：「我是東印度人，曾於布磔迦山觀自在菩薩像所發願為王，菩薩為我現身，
